item.title: The LG G3s will be the first to receive the Lollipop upgrade
item.description:
LG Electronics claims to be the first worldwide smartphone maker to launch the Lollipop update in 2014. According to LG, the updated Android operating system, Android 5.0 or “Lollipop,” will be available for its G3 smartphones starting in Poland the week of November 10, with other major markets following shortly after. Source: LG. This newest Android OS offers a variety of enhancements, including enhanced depth, shadows, and animations. With a fresh design and color scheme, notifications have been enhanced and will be visible on the new lock screen...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-lg-g3s-will-be-the-first-to-receive-the-lollipop-upgrade/

item.title: HTC has released the Android-powered Nexus 9, with pre-orders starting on October 17th
item.description:
HTC teamed up with Google to create the Nexus 9, the first tablet to launch with Android Lollipop*. This premium tablet is designed for an exceptional user experience. The Nexus 9 allows for extensive customization and features a suite of secure login functions for enhanced security. Multi-tasking is made easy with this device. The tablet boasts an 8.9-inch display with a 4:3 aspect ratio, all within a sleek brushed aluminum frame...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/htc-has-released-the-android-powered-nexus-9-with-pre-orders-starting-on-october-17th/
